column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////I got the chef's special spicy miso tonkotsu
column2: served with thick noodles. A spicy miso that was actually spicy! Yay! The broth was very flavorful and creamy
column3: which definitely made it more filling. The pork was cut into pieces
column4: but was still very appetizing. I added a soft-boiled egg to my bowl
column5: which I thought was cooked to perfection. I didn't think the portion was huge when they first brought it out
column6: but I could barely finish and had to force myself to get to the bottom of the bowl! The other bowls we ordered were Tonkotsu black and the spicy miso umami. I got to try a bit of the Tonkotsu black and I thought the broth had a very delicious and unique taste! Mmmm.
